event: Early Tibeto-Burman cultures settle the Irrawaddy basin
Pyu city-states flourish along inland trade routes
Bagan founded as a Burman power center
Anawrahta unifies Upper Burma and adopts Theravada Buddhism
Mongol invasions lead to the collapse of Bagan
Toungoo dynasty reunifies Myanmar and expands regionally
Konbaung dynasty rises after civil war
British annex Lower Burma after the First Anglo-Burmese War
Britain fully annexes Burma into British India
Japanese occupation disrupts British colonial rule
